meanings.definition: Make false and damaging statements about someone.
meanings.sent1: She was slandering her classmate by spreading lies about her.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to go around slandering others without any proof.
meanings.sent3: The gossiping parrot in the pet store was slandering all the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The rumors were slandering her reputation like a sharp knife cutting through butter.
meanings.sent5: The politician's opponent was slandering him with vicious words during the debate.

meanings.definition: The action of making false and damaging statements about someone.
meanings.sent1: The slandering of her character caused a lot of harm.
meanings.sent2: He was accused of participating in the slandering of his colleague.
meanings.sent3: The slandering at the office was like a never-ending soap opera.
meanings.sent4: The slandering in the courtroom was as loud as thunder on a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The slandering in the newspapers painted a dark picture of the celebrity's life.
